Events.OnCreate:
(switch ; This mission only works in Heretic (!= (sysGetNode) 'G2) (msnDestroy gSource)
; Set up the mission (block (anomalyPos anomalyObj) ; Create the anomaly (setq anomalyPos (sysVectorPolarOffset Nil (random 0 359) (random 100 450))) (setq anomalyObj (sysCreateMarker "anomaly" anomalyPos &svNeutral;)) (objSetData anomalyObj 'mradID (objGetID gSource)) ) )
Events.OnAccepted: (block (theItem) (setq theItem (itmCreate &itMRADExperiment; 1)) (setq theItem (itmSetData theItem 'mradID (objGetID gSource))) (objAddItem gPlayerShip theItem) (shpInstallDevice gPlayerShip theItem) )
Events.OnObjDocked:
(switch ; Only care about the player docking with owner while mission is active, ; so ignore anything else (or (!= aObjDocked gPlayerShip) (!= (objGetID aDockTarget) (msnGetProperty gSource 'ownerID)) (not (msnGetProperty gSource 'isActive)) ) Nil
(= (msnGetData gSource 'status) 'found) (objEnumItems gPlayerShip "d +MRADExperiment;" theItem (if (= (itmGetData theItem 'mradID) (objGetID gSource)) (msnSuccess gSource) (msnFailure gSource) ) )
(= (msnGetData gSource 'status) 'failed) (msnFailure gSource) )
Events.OnCanBrief:
(block (installResult) ; Check if we can install the MRAD experiment (setq installResult (rpgInstallDevicePrep { item: (itmCreate &itMRADExperiment; 1) totalPrice: 0 checkTotalPower: True installerObj: (objGetObjByID (msnGetProperty gSource 'ownerID)) itemInCargo: Nil })) (msnSetData gSource 'canInstall (@ installResult 'canInstall)) (msnSetData gSource 'installDesc (@ installResult 'desc))
(if (msnFind "a +hereticMission;") (msnTranslate gSource 'textBusy) ) )

Language.Text: Find a Graviton Anomaly with the MRAD Experiment

Use the MRAD device to deploy a series of probes and triangulate the location of the graviton anomaly.
System: %systemName%\n Payment: None

The chief scientist meets you at the entrance:
"Are you interested in helping us to learn more about the Iocrym? We're studying the spacetime distortion that the Iocrym are generating around the Heretic sun. Our only lead is a weak graviton anomaly coming from somewhere in the system.
"Will you help us find it?"

"We need you to deploy a series of probes to pinpoint the graviton anomaly. Each probe that you deploy will tell you something about the position of the anomaly. Use that information to deploy the next probe as close as possible to the anomaly. You must deploy one probe within 10 light-seconds of the anomaly in order for us to get any useful data.
"Will you help us?"
"Use the MRAD experiment device to deploy probes around the system. Remember that you need to deploy a probe within 10 light-seconds of the anomaly for us to get useful data."

%installDesc%
"Thanks anyways, come back later when you can help us."
"I'm almost positive that the graviton anomaly is related to the quarantine. If we could just study it, perhaps we could find a way to break out of this trap and into the rest of the galaxy."

"You haven't found the anomaly yet and you still have probes left!"
"Remember, each probe tells you something about the position of the anomaly. Use that information to figure out where the anomaly is."

The chief scientist greets you as you enter:
"The data you gathered on the graviton anomaly is amazing. It looks like the Iocrym can affect the core of a star!
"Take this data ROM and share it with the Svalbard Explorer; they may be able to use it."

"There's one more thing: we've detected recent energy readings at the edge of the system. Starships of some sort are entering the system. If I had to guess, I'd say that the Iocrym are back. Be careful."
"The MRAD experiment was the only way to study the graviton anomaly. You've just wasted five years of research!"

The chief scientist meets you at the entrance:
"We're studying the distortion that the Iocrym are generating around the Heretic sun. Come back when you're done with your current project and you can help us."
